availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Lyne (Henderson County, Kentucky, clerk and farmer.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, bank clerk and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah "Sallie" Carneal Starling Lyne in Henderson County, Kentucky, on January 2, 1849. Father of George Lyne, William Lyne, and Susan Lyne. Married to Ann Kelly Lyne in Henderson County, Kentucky, on October 14, 1860. Father of Dan Lyne, Hattie H. Lyne, and John K. Lyne. Clerk in Henderson County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Bank clerk in Henderson County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Employed two enslaved persons in 1860. Farmer in Henderson County in 1863.
